app.backend package

app.backend.auth_service module

auth_service.py

Backend authentication functionality and JWT token management.

This module provides functions for password hashing, JWT token creation and verification, user authentication, login, registration, and logout operations.

app.backend.auth_service.authenticate_user(email: str, password: str, db: Session) → User | None[source]

Authenticate a user with email and password.

Parameters:

  • email – User’s email.

  • password – User’s password.

  • db – Database session dependency.

Returns:

User object if authentication is successful, None otherwise.

app.backend.auth_service.create_access_token(email: str, user_id: int) → str[source]

Create a short-living access token for authentication.

Parameters:

  • email – User’s email.

  • user_id – User’s ID.

Returns:

JWT access token as a string.

app.backend.auth_service.create_refresh_token(email: str, user_id: int) → str[source]

Create a long-living refresh token used to generate new access tokens.

Parameters:

  • email – User’s email.

  • user_id – User’s ID.

Returns:

JWT refresh token as a string.

app.backend.auth_service.get_current_user(access_token: str | None = Cookie(None), refresh_token: str | None = Cookie(None), db: ~sqlmodel.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_session>, use_cache=True, scope=None), response: ~starlette.responses.Response = None) → User[source]

Retrieve the currently authenticated user based on access token.

If the access token is expired but a valid refresh token exists, it issues a new access token.

Parameters:

  • access_token – JWT access token from cookies.

  • refresh_token – JWT refresh token from cookies.

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • response – FastAPI Response object used to refresh access token if needed.

Returns:

User object representing the currently authenticated user.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 if no valid tokens are present or user not found.

app.backend.auth_service.get_password_hash(password: str) → str[source]

Hash a plain password using Argon2.

Parameters:

password – Password to hash.

Returns:

Hashed password as a string.

app.backend.auth_service.issue_tokens_and_set_cookies(user: User, response: Response) → None[source]

Issue both access and refresh tokens and set them as HTTP-only cookies.

Parameters:

  • user – Authenticated user for whom the tokens are issued.

  • response – FastAPI Response object used to set cookies.

app.backend.auth_service.login_for_access_token(email: str, password: str, db: Session, response: Response) → TokenResponse[source]

Log in a user and issue JWT tokens as cookies.

Parameters:

  • email – User’s email.

  • password – User’s password.

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • response – FastAPI Response object used to set authentication cookies.

Returns:

TokenResponse object containing access token and token type.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 if authentication fails.

app.backend.auth_service.logout_user(response: Response) → None[source]

Log out a user by deleting authentication cookies.

Parameters:

response – FastAPI Response object used to delete cookies.

app.backend.auth_service.refresh_access_token(refresh_token: str, response: Response) → str[source]

Refresh the access token using a valid refresh token.

If the access token has expired, verifies the refresh token and issues a new access token, setting it in the response cookies.

Parameters:

  • refresh_token – JWT refresh token.

  • response – FastAPI Response object used to set the new access token cookie.

Returns:

New JWT access token as a string.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 if refresh token is missing, invalid, or expired.

app.backend.auth_service.register_user(request: UserRegister, db: Session, response: Response) → User[source]

Register a new user and issue JWT tokens.

Parameters:

  • request – UserRegister Pydantic model containing registration info.

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • response – FastAPI Response object used to set authentication cookies.

Returns:

Newly created User object.

Raises:

HTTPException – 400 if the email is already registered.

app.backend.auth_service.verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool[source]

Verify a plain password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – Password provided by the user.

  • hashed_password – Stored hashed password.

Returns:

True if the password matches, False otherwise.

app.backend.auth_service.verify_token(token: str) → TokenData[source]

Verify a JWT token and extract user data.

Parameters:

token – JWT token string to verify.

Returns:

TokenData object containing user_id.

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 if token is invalid or expired.

app.backend.comment_service module

comment_service.py

Backend commenting functionality.

This module provides functions for creating comments and retrieving comments associated with events, including user information.

app.backend.comment_service.create_comment(db: Session, event_id: int, user_id: int, content: str) → CommentRead[source]

Create a new comment for a given event.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • event_id – ID of the event to which the comment belongs.

  • user_id – ID of the user creating the comment.

  • content – Text content of the comment.

Returns:

CommentRead object containing comment ID, user login, content, and creation timestamp.

app.backend.comment_service.get_comments_for_event(db: Session, event_id: int, limit: int = 20, offset: int = 0) → list[CommentRead][source]

Retrieve comments for a specific event, ordered by creation time descending.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • event_id – ID of the event for which to retrieve comments.

  • limit – Maximum number of comments to return (default 20).

  • offset – Number of comments to skip for pagination (default 0).

Returns:

List of CommentRead objects including comment ID, user login, content, and creation timestamp.

app.backend.event_invitation_service module

event_pass_service.py

Logic for event pass creation and consumption.

Handles: - Secure token generation and hashing - Pass resolution and validation - Guest user creation - Pass-to-user binding - Authentication via existing auth service

app.backend.event_invitation_service.create_event_invite(event_id: int, db: Session) → str[source]

Create a new event invite for a specific event.

Parameters:

  • event_id – ID of the event for which the pass is created.

  • db – Database session dependency.

Returns:

Raw token string that can be shared with the user.

app.backend.event_invitation_service.generate_invite_token() → str[source]

Generate a secure random token for an event invite.

Returns:

URL-safe token string.

app.backend.event_invitation_service.hash_invite_token(token: str) → str[source]

Hash an event pass token using SHA256.

Parameters:

token – Raw event pass token.

Returns:

Hashed token string.

app.backend.event_invitation_service.resolve_event_invitation(token: str, db: Session) → EventInvitation[source]

Resolve and validate an event invitation token.

Parameters:

  • token – Raw token string to resolve.

  • db – Database session dependency.

Returns:

EventInvitation object corresponding to the token.

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 if the token is invalid.

app.backend.event_pass_service module

event_pass_service.py

Logic for event pass creation and consumption.

Handles: - Secure token generation and hashing - Pass resolution and validation - Guest user creation - Pass-to-user binding - Authentication via existing auth service

app.backend.event_pass_service.bind_pass_to_user(event_pass: EventPass, user: User, db: Session) → None[source]

Bind an event pass to a specific user.

Parameters:

  • event_pass – EventPass object to bind.

  • user – User object to bind the pass to.

  • db – Database session dependency.

Raises:

HTTPException – 409 if the pass is already bound to another user.

app.backend.event_pass_service.create_event_pass(event_id: int, display_name: str, db: Session, expires_at=None) → str[source]

Create a new event pass for a specific event.

Parameters:

  • event_id – ID of the event for which the pass is created.

  • display_name – Display name for the guest user associated with the pass.

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • expires_at – Optional expiration datetime for the pass.

Returns:

Raw token string that can be shared with the user.

app.backend.event_pass_service.create_guest_user(display_name: str, db: Session) → User[source]

Create a new guest user.

Parameters:

  • display_name – Display name for the guest user.

  • db – Database session dependency.

Returns:

Newly created User object with is_guest=True.

app.backend.event_pass_service.generate_pass_token() → str[source]

Generate a secure random token for an event pass.

Returns:

URL-safe token string.

app.backend.event_pass_service.hash_pass_token(token: str) → str[source]

Hash an event pass token using SHA256.

Parameters:

token – Raw event pass token.

Returns:

Hashed token string.

app.backend.event_pass_service.login_via_pass(*, event_pass: EventPass, response: Response, db: Session) → None[source]

Log in a user via an existing event pass.

Parameters:

  • event_pass – EventPass object representing the pass.

  • response – FastAPI Response object used to set authentication cookies.

  • db – Database session dependency.

Raises:

  • HTTPException – 400 if the pass is not bound to a user.

  • HTTPException – 401 if the user associated with the pass does not exist.

app.backend.event_pass_service.resolve_event_pass(token: str, db: Session) → EventPass[source]

Resolve and validate an event pass token.

Parameters:

  • token – Raw token string to resolve.

  • db – Database session dependency.

Returns:

EventPass object corresponding to the token.

Raises:

HTTPException – 404 if the token is invalid.

app.backend.event_service module

event_service.py

Backend event CRUD operations.

Provides functions to create, read, update, and delete events in the database.

app.backend.event_service.create_event(db: Session, data: EventCreate, owner_id: int) → Event[source]

Create a new event in the database.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • data – EventCreate object containing event details.

  • owner_id – ID of the user creating the event.

Returns:

Newly created Event object.

app.backend.event_service.delete_event(db: Session, event_id: int, user_id: int) → bool | str[source]

Delete an event from the database.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • event_id – ID of the event to delete.

  • user_id – ID of the user attempting the deletion.

Returns:

True if deleted successfully, “forbidden” if user is not the owner, False if the event does not exist.

app.backend.event_service.get_event(db: Session, event_id: int) → Event | None[source]

Retrieve a single event by its ID.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • event_id – ID of the event to retrieve.

Returns:

Event object if found, None otherwise.

app.backend.event_service.get_events(db: Session) → list[Event][source]

Retrieve all events from the database.

Parameters:

db – Database session dependency.

Returns:

List of Event objects.

app.backend.event_service.update_event(db: Session, event_id: int, user_id: int, data: EventUpdate) → Event | str | None[source]

Update an existing event’s details.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • event_id – ID of the event to update.

  • user_id – ID of the user attempting the update.

  • data – EventUpdate object containing new values.

Returns:

Updated Event object if successful, “forbidden” if the user is not the owner, or None if the event does not exist.

app.backend.participations_service module

participation_service.py

Backend participation survey functionality.

Provides functions for setting user participation, retrieving event participation statistics, and listing events a user is involved with.

app.backend.participations_service.get_event_participation_stats(db: Session, *, event_id: int) → dict[ParticipationStatus, int][source]

Retrieve statistics for an event’s participation survey.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • event_id – ID of the event.

Returns:

Dictionary mapping ParticipationStatus to counts: {

ParticipationStatus.going: int, ParticipationStatus.maybe: int, ParticipationStatus.not_going: int, ParticipationStatus.invited: int

}

app.backend.participations_service.get_user_active_events(db: Session, *, user_id: int) → list[dict][source]

Get a list of events where the user is an owner or has a participation status.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • user_id – ID of the user.

Returns:

List of dictionaries containing event details and the user’s participation status: [

{

“id”: int, “name”: str, “location”: str, “time”: str (ISO format), “owner_id”: int, “participation_status”: str | None

]

app.backend.participations_service.join_event(db: Session, *, user_id: int, event_id: int) → EventParticipation[source]

Set participation status of a user as invited for a specific event.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • user_id – ID of the user.

  • event_id – ID of the event.

Returns:

EventParticipation object representing the newly created participation.

app.backend.participations_service.set_participation(db: Session, *, user_id: int, event_id: int, status: ParticipationStatus) → EventParticipation[source]

Set or update a user’s participation status for an event.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • user_id – ID of the user participating in the event.

  • event_id – ID of the event.

  • status – ParticipationStatus enum value (going, maybe, not_going, invited).

Returns:

EventParticipation object representing the updated or newly created participation.

app.backend.user_service module

user_service.py

Basic functionality for the User model.

Provides functions to retrieve users, change passwords, and delete users.

app.backend.user_service.change_password(db: Session, user_id: int, data: PasswordChange) → bool[source]

Change the password of a user after verifying the current password.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • user_id – ID of the user whose password is being changed.

  • data – PasswordChange object containing current and new passwords.

Returns:

True if password was changed successfully, False otherwise (invalid current password, mismatch in new password confirmation, or user not found).

app.backend.user_service.delete_user(db: Session, user_id: int) → bool[source]

Delete a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • user_id – ID of the user to delete.

Returns:

True if deleted successfully, False if user does not exist.

app.backend.user_service.get_user(db: Session, user_id: int) → User | None[source]

Retrieve a single user by their ID.

Parameters:

  • db – Database session dependency.

  • user_id – ID of the user to retrieve.

Returns:

User object if found, None otherwise.

app.backend.user_service.get_users(db: Session) → list[User][source]

Retrieve all users from the database.

Parameters:

db – Database session dependency.

Returns:

List of User objects.
